results.definition: the event of something ending
examples: it came to a stop at the bottom of the hill

results.definition: the act of stopping something
examples: the third baseman made some remarkable stops
his stoppage of the flow resulted in a flood

results.definition: a brief stay in the course of a journey
examples: they made a stopover to visit their friends

results.definition: the state of inactivity following an interruption
examples: the negotiations were in arrest
held them in check
during the halt he got some lunch
the momentary stay enabled him to escape the blow
he spent the entire stop in his seat

results.definition: a spot where something halts or pauses
examples: his next stop is Atlanta

results.definition: a consonant produced by stopping the flow of air at some point and suddenly releasing it
examples: his stop consonants are too aspirated

results.definition: a punctuation mark (.) placed at the end of a declarative sentence to indicate a full stop or after abbreviations
examples: in England they call a period a stop

results.definition: (music) a knob on an organ that is pulled to change the sound quality from the organ pipes
examples: the organist pulled out all the stops

results.definition: a mechanical device in a camera that controls size of aperture of the lens
examples: the new cameras adjust the diaphragm automatically

results.definition: a restraint that checks the motion of something
examples: he used a book as a stop to hold the door open

results.definition: an obstruction in a pipe or tube
examples: we had to call a plumber to clear out the blockage in the drainpipe

results.definition: come to a halt, stop moving
examples: the car stopped
She stopped in front of a store window

results.definition: put an end to a state or an activity
examples: Quit teasing your little brother

results.definition: stop from happening or developing
examples: Block his election
Halt the process

results.definition: interrupt a trip
examples: we stopped at Aunt Mary's house
they stopped for three days in Florence

results.definition: cause to stop
examples: stop a car
stop the thief

results.definition: prevent completion
examples: stop the project
break off the negotiations

results.definition: hold back, as of a danger or an enemy; check the expansion or influence of
examples: Arrest the downward trend
Check the growth of communism in South East Asia
Contain the rebel movement
Turn back the tide of communism

results.definition: seize on its way
examples: The fighter plane was ordered to intercept an aircraft that had entered the country's airspace

results.definition: have an end, in a temporal, spatial, or quantitative sense; either spatial or metaphorical
examples: the bronchioles terminate in a capillary bed
Your rights stop where you infringe upon the rights of other
My property ends by the bushes
The symphony ends in a pianissimo

results.definition: render unsuitable for passage
examples: block the way
barricade the streets
stop the busy road

results.definition: stop and wait, as if awaiting further instructions or developments
examples: Hold on a moment!
